item.title: Journal: Latter Half of October '17
item.description: So here is an update on what I’ve been doing in the latter half of October. Prometheus I’m finally playing around with Prometheus and monitoring which is something I wanted to do for a long time. I’ve started by creating a 5 node cluster on GKE and then following a simple guide, Kubernetes monitoring with Prometheus in 15 minutes by Giancarlo Rubio. Afterwards, I watched two talks about the subject Monitoring, the Prometheus Way by Julius Volz, one of the founders of Prometheus.

item.title: Let There be a Domain
item.description: Now that the blog is back up finally we can finally get around to setting up a domain. First thing we would need is a static IP to point the domain to. So let’s do. Static IP on GKE for a Kubernetes Service I did not find an official guide on how to do this. Fortunately, I found a blog post and a Stack Overflow answer that explains how to accomplish this.

item.title: From 0 to Blogging: WordPress on Kubernetes
item.description: I want to become a SRE/Distributed Systems Engineer. An expert in the field suggested I started small by setting up a WordPress blog using Kubernetes + Docker on a local machine or a cloud like a droplet from Digital Ocean or GKE from Google. So this is my journey setting up a blog. Udacity 615: Scalable Microservices with Kubernetes I was debating where to start since I wasn’t familiar with Kubernetes or Docker.
